cont.entity_a: Offers good performance for small spaces.
cont.entity_b: Good range and performance when it works.

cont.entity_a: Stopped spontaneously, requiring frequent reboots by disconnecting from the power source.
cont.entity_b: Requires daily reboots due to USB hard drive issues.

cont.entity_a: Firmware upgrade is necessary to sustain TCP connections.
cont.entity_b: Firmware has serious issues with NAT, wireless connection, USB storage, and DHCP.

cont.entity_a: Limited range and requires frequent resets.
cont.entity_b: Has less range than older models.

cont.entity_a: Linksys offers limited support for Macs, and firmware upgrades are Windows-only.
cont.entity_b: The product is discontinued, with no firmware support.

cont.entity_a: Cannot support more than one Xbox connected to Xbox Live at a time.
cont.entity_b: No wireless N devices will connect.

cont.entity_a: The router is generally easy to set up but may have issues with DHCP and firmware.
cont.entity_b: Highly configurable and reliable once set up.

cont.entity_a: The product is obsolete compared to modern routers.
The wireless option is poor, with reception issues beyond 15-20 feet.
cont.entity_b: The USB attachment for network shared disk drive works poorly.

cont.entity_a: The user guide is written for Network Engineers and lacks key information for NT and 2000 users.
Installation software simplifies setup, but issues persist with Windows 2000.
cont.entity_b: DD-WRT software adds many features but may require multiple reboots.
The product is not recommended over $100 due to connectivity issues.
